title: Practice Challenge: Safe Data Access
description:
You're building a user profile display. The API sometimes returns incomplete data. Use optional chaining and nullish coalescing to safely access properties and provide defaults.

1. Get the user's city (default: 'Unknown')
2. Get the user's email (default: 'No email provided')
3. Get the user's age (default: 'Age not specified') - careful with 0!
4. Get the first hobby (default: 'No hobbies listed')
instructions: Use optional chaining (?.) and nullish coalescing (??) to safely extract data with defaults.

hints.text: Remember: ?? only triggers on null/undefined, so age of 0 won't trigger the default!

commonMistakes.consequence: Age of 0 would be replaced with the default string
commonMistakes.correction: Use ?? to preserve falsy values like 0: userData?.age ?? 'default'

commonMistakes.consequence: Would crash if hobbies array is null/undefined
commonMistakes.correction: Use userData?.hobbies?.[0] to safely access array elements
